p: The paper by Hong et al. focused on atopic dermatitis (AD), of unknown origin. KHU-ATO-JIN-D (KAJD) which is a poly-herbal mixture of extracts from six plants, known to have anti-inflammatory and antiallergic effects, was found to inhibit the development of DNCB-induced AD in BALB/c mice and several immune cell types, suggesting that KAJD might be a useful therapeutic drug for the treatment of AD ( Hong et al.).
